Media coverage of @AOC's Green New Deal has focused on "strategy" over substance: asking "is it popular?" instead of "is it a good policy idea?"

That's called "tactical framing," and it's making us more cynical about big policy ideas: pic.twitter.com/BCWtml3X46

Invisibilia is one of the best podcasts I‚Äôve ever heard so this just made my night. The love and thoughtfulness y‚Äôall bring to your work is unreal. I already love this season. And I relisten to ‚Äúfuture self‚Äù whenever I need a good cry.
(Sorry for being clingy I just really love yalls podcast)
I love your work!  You crack me up. Do you live in DC? If so you should let me and Hanna take you out.
I moved to NYC after 7 years in DC in august. Can I take you up on that offer next time I‚Äôm down there?
Isn't this media coverage of everything these days?

It is.

And it's a problem.

The peoples of late stage capitalism blame it on target marketing causing people to objectify themselves.

Righties blame reactionary tendencies that fail to reexamine 

Leftists point out dishonest intent of messaging.

Perhaps they're all correct.

As attention spans run shorter media outlets latch onto whatever can hold our attention. Slippery slope argumentation is more profitable than thoughtful debate. That slope breeds anxiety, fear and outrage. Those emotions keep viewers tuned in. Everything else is an economic risk.

We really have to get on that education reform.

Maybe throw a class in during the school day for self discipline and let kids pick from some form of self defense, yoga or meditation?

I don't know how directly those thoughts relate for you, but I see correlation

Kids spend their day learning to sit still and follow instruction

Then wonder why they go wild when they get some freedom

It seems to me an unnatural process, never learn to control ones own mind

Media in general is a little too concerned with what‚Äôs popular and not enough with ‚Äúwhat is the right thing, here?‚Äù 

Taxes aren‚Äôt popular, but they‚Äôre the right thing. Frame them around what they provide in return: infrastructure, public programs, etc.
I wish the Green New deal was around to save the dinosaurs, continental, divide and numerous ice agaves.
Me too. Now all we have is the agaves that grow in the tropics. Ice agaves would have been a nice change.
psycocat osiris_neits EBohannon89 KuraFire gaywonk AOC
Yeah, same. I‚Äôm thinking ‚Äúare we talking about a tequila luge?‚Äù Cause that might help once we‚Äôre all on fire.
so @AOC? How exactly are we going to pay for the New Green Deal? That's the part I still want to know and so far your group hasn't given any solid answer
Ending tax loopholes on the very wealthy would MORE THAN pay for it, and she's SAID THIS multiple times.  Stop pretending ignorance.

exactly how much is this deal going to cost then in a given time period? and when you say that ending tax loopholes on the very wealthy will cover for everything, have you actually accounted that for future inflation rate? the whole deal sounds great, but still lacks hard figures

I‚Äôm going to assume you‚Äôre asking in good faith here and the question of how we ‚Äúpay‚Äù for things like infrastructure projects proposed in the GND is not about finding new revenue streams to fund it all as much as it is a realignment of where we allocate federal funds.

A good example would be the billions in federal subsidies the US gives to fossil fuel companies. Reallocate those to wind and solar. Address the out of control military budget. And infrastructure like public transit is also increasing revenue, providing jobs, etc.
I mean the US could also like, not spend 600 billion on defence. Idk just a thought
But then we wouldn‚Äôt have all those 30 billion dollar fighter jets that don‚Äôt function enough to even guarantee the pilots won‚Äôt be decapitated.
GND is a marketing campaign: get the lower middle class to support green projects by promising redistribution; get the upper middle class to support redistribution by promising green.
Or.. Get them to support green projects because the price of clean water will only go up, and the cost of health care is already transferring wealth away from them.
How often does the media apply this tactical framing to corporate friendly policies, as in ‚ÄúWill this neoliberalism divide the Democrats?‚Äù
Or ‚ÄúBut how will we pay for it?‚Äù
Funny how they don‚Äôt focus as much on the unpopularity of, say, cutting Medicare by billions like Trump is doing.
They do but it's lost in a sea of lie counts and what will he do next what ifs.
This is a brilliant video. Tactical framing. Substance-free politics + substance-free political journalism = badly uninformed electorate. Thank you Carlos.

The side that pushes the statistically-illiterate pay gap, the false narratives of BLM, a huge undercount of illegal immigrants, claims the Crime Bill pushed for by blcks & voted for by most blck Congressmen is racist - THAT side cannot complain about an uninformed electorate.

Grapple with reality.
Thankfully, the Constitution dodged the tactical framers.

Good point. We also didn't have a full-scale road map for the Old New Deal at the start. The Socialists were the unsung heroes of that one and it pretty much saved Capitalism from itself. The point of the framework is to bring people together to hash out the ideas and discuss.
